sub_title: Manager Supply Quality Assurance, Europe at Anheuser-Busch InBev
summary:
My passion is to manage group of experts at my work and to manage volunteers on my free time. Working in a results-oriented international and social environment keeps me motivated.

As the Supply Quality Assurance Manager at the worlds largest brewer AB-InBev, I'm leading a team of 6 quality specialists, ensuring safety, high quality and high performance of all raw material and packaging material categories in our 26 breweries and 3 vertical operations in Europe - being processed into best beer in the world.

I have solid experience of managing complex R&D projects in fast-paced global environment. I love to build teams and see my idea on a product or process to scale up.

In 2017-2020 I led projects as a principal development engineer for fiber and polymer packaging at AB-InBev global R&D. I owned large project portfolio with high complexity, multiple project managers and execution world wide. Projects focused on cutting costs and improving sustainability of fiber packaging (corrugated boards, folding cartons and labels). I was center of excellence for pulp, paper-making and converting processes and as such engaged in trouble-shooting quality of commercial products, consulting global procurement, validating technical road maps for commercial innovation and delivering savings trough technical innovations.

During 2015 - 2016, I specialized in High Pressure Laminate products, raw materials and converting processes at Trespa International. My role as senior development engineer, responsible for paper development was highly independent.  I was part of international and entrepreneurial mindset R&D team of 30 people. I specialized on decor paper, saturating base kraft (SBK) paper development, converting, manufacturing and sourcing.

Between 2010 and 2014 I focused on folding box board production process and packaging R&D at m-real (now Metsä Board).  In 2010 I received a CSCP (Certified Supply Chain Professional) degree.

Since 2009, I’ve gained experience on leadership and R&D project management.
In 2009 I wrote my master's thesis at one of the larges Finnish chemical companies Kemira. Link to my work " Optimization of ASA emulsification in internal sizing of paper and board":
http://lib.tkk.fi/Dipl/2009/urn100102.pdf

During 2005 - 2010 I worked at UPM-Kymmene on specialty papers manufacturing (release base, kraft paper) production.
In 2006 - 2007 I had a Finnish Defense Forces training and graduated at the highest rank of Second Lieutenant, having a task of commanding a 30-person anti-tank troop.

I speak Finnish, English, Swedish and German - some Dutch.

patents.title: Process for producing paper or paperboard, in particular label paper or paperboard suited for use as packaging material for beverage containers, and paper or paperboard produced by this process

projects.title: KOTVA
projects.description: In the KOTVA, VTT and the University of Jyväskylä combine their knowledge in developing new production and measurement technologies for foam forming. Other partners of the project are UPM, Stora-Enso, M-real, Metso, Kemira, Omya, Wetend Technologies and Vision Systems, and the cities of Jyväskylä, Äänekoski and Jämsä. The project is funded (EUR 917,778) by the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) via the Regional Council of Central Finland.

projects.title: Efficient Networking towards Novel Products and Processes (EffNet)
projects.description: ‘’Efficient Networking Towards Novel Products and Processes’’ program is direct continuation of  ‘’Intelligent and resource efficient production technologies” program started in June 2008. The program provides new research based solutions to improve resource efficiency and to accelerate development of new fiber based products and process concepts.  The budget of this three year program is around € 15 million.

projects.title: Concepts for Raw Material and Energy Efficient Products (CREPs)
projects.description: The project will evaluate novel paper and board production concepts, mainly in pilot scale using Innventia's new stock preparation pilot plant. The kick-off meeting will take place at Innventia on June 30 and July 1. The project will be financed by paper and board manufacturers as well as by suppliers to the paper and board industry.

contributors.headline: Manager Supply Quality Assurance, Europe at Anheuser-Busch InBev

projects.title: Side seam glueability of folding box board
projects.description:
Master's Thesis project was planned and organised together with the University and the thesis worker in between January 2014 – August 2014 regarding the development of packaging lab which I was responsible for.
The goal of the master thesis was to interview Metsä Board personnel to gather all the knowledge and knowledge they had about side seam glueability of folding boxboard and to find out the folding box board converting and customer need related possible problems the company. Glue suppliers were also interviewed, as well as internal board mill managers and food factory managers to find out the most important side seam properties in board converting.

A literature research was made in combination with interview results to make a summary of all the possible issues that could cause failure of the glue seam in board converting and the following steps in the supply chain.
Base on the finding from literature and interviews the traditional seam test done by peeling with hands was improved and more sophisticated methods developed, resulting into a fully repeatable test combining mechanical and optical analysis that can tell you almost all you need to know about performance of the side seam between the glue and the paper board.
After the thesis and method development, the concept has been utilised to solve claims regarding side seam gluing issues very successfully in the company enabling to gain cost savings and more deeper knowledge regarding packaging industry as such.

projects.title: MSc. project: Optimization of ASA emulsification in internal sizing of paper and board
projects.description: Commercial and pre-commercial ASA (Alkenyl Succinic Anhydride) products of Kemira were tested in order to find functional and cost-efficient end products for paper industry B2B customers. Kemira's own product scale was also studied. The thesis was done at Kemira ERDC from April to November, 2009.

projects.title: Clean1/Pimu
projects.description: Projects Clean1 and PIMU dealt with papermachine process cleanliness through the chemicals point of view and the modification of surfaces present at papermachine, in order to keep them clean and ease up the cleaning process of dirty surfaces, such as steam- and press rolls and felt- and wire surfaces. My work as assisting research scientist consisted of experimental work with paper chemicals and results reporting with Microsoft Office programs.

authors.headline: Manager Supply Quality Assurance, Europe at Anheuser-Busch InBev

profile_positions.description: Leading team of 6 specialists, ensuring that 26 breweries and 4 vertical operations in Europe receive safe, high performing and high quality raw materials and packaging materials from qualified suppliers with whom together with our operations we drive excellence to bring people together for the best beers.
profile_positions.title: Manager Supply Quality Assurance, Europe

profile_positions.description:
R&D projects management related to natural fibre products portfolio (consisting of label papers, carton boards and corrugated boards).

Responsibility for Technology Strategy on paper which involves design, material, and manufacturing of cartons and labels and strong collaboration with vertical operations and key technology partners.

Owner of Technology Platforms on paper with commitments to deliver savings to the business and to develop capabilities to establish and sustain competitive advantage.

Led execution of front end feasibility, development and first implementation of technologies that are new to the industry. Also led the the Center of Excellence for papers and cartons, facilitating information sharing and collaboration across the network and prioritizing new technologies for development - industry recognized expert on papers and cartons, building strategies and leading projects to create added value.
profile_positions.title: Global Principal Engineer - Paper Material & Technology Development

profile_positions.description: Share life and equip others to do the same.
profile_positions.title: Netherlands contact person XEE

profile_positions.description:
R&D Project Management and execution - leading the Paper Cluster as a paper specialist:
*Paper development for Trespa International B.V. and Arpa Industriale S.p.A. together with paper suppliers and converting companies
*Internal knowledge sharing related to natural fibre products, applications, process technology, physics and chemistry
*Trouble-shooting daily operations at production lines: paper impregnation with resins, acrylic coating/EB curing of impregnated papers, laminate pressing
*Scaling up technologies from idea to lab to pilot to industrial scale
*Supporting Purchasing with regards to paper products and related process equipment price negotiations and decision-making
*Operating and indenpendent decision-making in highly international and constantly changing working atmosphere in a flat organisation
profile_positions.title: Senior Development Engineer, Paper Specialist

profile_positions.description:
R&D Project management
Project team management
The tasks consist of long-term strategic development of board-making process and innovative new folding box board products. The scope is to create competitive edge to competitors by saving raw materials, energy and water:
*new/altered process equipment
*simplifying processes
*finding new raw materials to replace old ones (for example new type of pulp in paper making)
*inventing new production technologies
*inventing new processes (for example new forming media in paper making)
Writing a PhD on fibre-based packaging aside work
